snippet: As the crowd turned on South Africa’s president at the memorial for Nelson Mandela, and controversy surrounded a handshake, top officials in Israel and Iran may have been glad they had skipped the ceremony.
abstract: As the crowd turned on South Africa’s president at the memorial for Nelson Mandela, and controversy surrounded a handshake, top officials in Israel and Iran may have been glad they had skipped the ceremony.

headline.main: Leaders of Israel and Iran Praise Mandela, From a Safe Distance
